simulation.engine
Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
  simulation.engine.Simulation

public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object

A system of objects.

Author:
Jacob Taylor

step

public void step(double amount,
                 int times)
Steps the simulation times times for the specified amount of time each time. All this does is call step(amount) more than once with only one event (at the end).

Parameters:
amount - - the number of time units for each step.
times - - the number of times to step.

bodyAt

public Body bodyAt(Vector point)
Get a body at a certain point, or null if no body is there.

Parameters:
point - the point to get the body at
Returns:
the body at the point, or null if there are none there

addBody

public void addBody(Body body)
Adds a body to the simulation.

Parameters:
body - - the body to add.

removeBody

public void removeBody(Body body)
Removes the specified body. If more than one instance of the specified body exists in the simulation, it only removes the first one.

Parameters:
body - - the body to remove.

addSpring

public void addSpring(Spring s)
Add a spring to the system.

Parameters:
s - the spring to add

addPhysicsListener

public void addPhysicsListener(PhysicsListener listener)
Registers a new PhysicsListener for this model. This listener will be notified when the model's state changes. While no guarantee of order strictly exists, the current implementation does maintain a set order of listeners.

Parameters:
listener - - the listener to register.

getListeners

public PhysicsListener[] getListeners()
Returns an array of all the physics listeners currently registered to this model.

Returns:
an array of PhysicsListeners.

removePhysicsListener

public void removePhysicsListener(PhysicsListener listener)
Removes the specified listener. If the listener is not registered to this model, nothing happens. If the listener is registered twice, then only one instance is removed and the listener will still be notified at least once.

Parameters:
listener - - the PhysicsListener to remove.

addBodySetListener

public void addBodySetListener(BodySetListener listener)
Registers a new BodySetListener for this simulation. This listener will be notified when a Body is either added or removed from the simulation. While no guarantee of order strictly exists, the current implementation does maintain a set order of listeners.

Parameters:
listener - - the listener to register.

getBodySetListeners

public BodySetListener[] getBodySetListeners()
Returns an array of all the BodySetListeners currently registered to this Simulation.

Returns:
an array of all the BodySetListeners currently registered to this Simulation.

removeBodySetListener

public void removeBodySetListener(BodySetListener listener)
Removes the specified listener. If the listener is not registered to this Simulation, nothing happens. If the listeners is registered twice, it is only removed once and will still continue to be notified at least once.

Parameters:
listener - - the listener to remove.

setPlaying

public void setPlaying(boolean playing)
Sets whether this simulation is "playing." Playing generally means that the simulation is being stepped repeatedly to animate it; when it is playing, most tools (like shape adding/moving) are probably going to be off.

Parameters:
playing - - whether the simulation is "playing."

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying()
Tells whether this simulations is "playing."Playing generally means that the simulation is being stepped repeatedly to animate it; when it is playing, most tools (like shape adding/moving) are probably going to be off.

Returns:
whether the simulation is "playing."

setGravity

public void setGravity(double gravity)
Sets the gravity force to a new value. This value dictates how hard the gravity pulls on various objects; a value of 0 means to no gravity and a value <0 means to anti-gravity.

Parameters:
gravity - - the new gravity to set. If it is null then there is no gravity.

getGravity

public double getGravity()
Returns the current strength of the gravity.This value dictates how hard the gravity pulls on various objects; a value of 0 means no gravity and a value <0 means anti-gravity.

Returns:
the gravity

reset

public void reset()
Resets the simulation, getting rid of all the bodies and springs. This method fires stateChanged after clearing the two lists.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width of this simulation, that is the farthest limit of any shape that represents a body.

Returns:
the "width" of the simulation.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns the height of this simulation. The height of the simulation is the distance between the top of the top-most shape and the bottom of the bottom-most shape.

Returns:
the "height" of the simulation.

getXMin

public int getXMin()
Returns how far the camera must move to get the left-most shape.

Returns:
the x-offset.

getYMin

public int getYMin()
Returns how far the camera must move to get the lowest shape.

Returns:
- the y-offset.

getXMax

public int getXMax()

getYMax

public int getYMax()

toArchiveString

public java.lang.String toArchiveString()

setWallColor

public void setWallColor(java.awt.Color wallColor)
Sets the walls' color. If the color supplied is null, then nothing happens and no exception is thrown.

Parameters:
wallColor - - the walls' new color.

getWallColor

public java.awt.Color getWallColor()
Returns the walls' color.

Returns:
the walls' color.

containsBody

public boolean containsBody(Body body)
Returns whether the specified body is contained within this system.

Parameters:
body - - the body to check for.
Returns:
whether the specified body exists.

getBodyCount

public int getBodyCount()
Returns the number of bodies this simulation currently has.

Returns:
the number of bodies this simulation currently has.

update

public void update()
Updates the model -- all this really does is fire an event to make sure everything using the model knows it has been updated.
